title: Verify Beads CLI Installation
description: Ensure the `bd` CLI tool is properly installed and accessible in the DevFlow environment. The CLI is needed for all Beads operations.

title: Create Beads View Component Structure
description:
Create `apps/ui/src/components/views/beads-view/` directory structure:

- `beads-view.tsx` - Main view container
- `components/`
  - `beads-header.tsx` - Toolbar with filters
  - `beads-issue-list.tsx` - Issue list view
  - `beads-issue-detail.tsx` - Issue detail view
  - `beads-dependency-graph.tsx` - Dependency visualization
- `hooks/`
  - `use-beads-client.ts` - API client hook
  - `use-beads-issues.ts` - Issue data management
  - `use-beads-subscription.ts` - Real-time subscriptions
- `types.ts` - View-specific types

title: Implement HTTP API Client for Beads
description:
Create `apps/ui/src/lib/beads-client.ts` following DevFlow's existing HTTP API client pattern.

Methods to implement:
- `connect(projectPath)` - Initialize connection
- `getReady(filter)` - Get actionable work
- `listIssues(filter)` - List all issues
- `getIssue(id)` - Get issue details
- `createIssue(issue)` - Create new issue
- `updateIssue(id, updates)` - Update issue
- `sync()` - Git synchronization
- `onUpdate(callback)` - Subscribe to real-time updates

title: Implement Beads Issue List View
description:
Create `beads-issue-list.tsx` component displaying:

- Sortable/filterable issue table
- Columns: ID, Title, Status, Priority, Type, Assignee
- Status badges (open, in_progress, blocked, closed)
- Priority indicators (P0-P4)
- Type icons (bug, feature, task, epic)
- Click to view details
- Real-time updates from WebSocket

Follow DevFlow's design system (colors, spacing, typography).

title: Implement Beads Issue Detail View
description:
Create `beads-issue-detail.tsx` component showing:

- Full issue title and description
- Status, priority, type (editable)
- Assignee, labels
- Dependencies (blocking/blocked by)
- Comments timeline
- Edit/inline-update capabilities
- Actions: close, reopen, assign

Use DevFlow's dialog patterns for editing.

title: Implement Dependency Graph Visualization
description:
Create `beads-dependency-graph.tsx` component:

- Visualize issue dependency relationships
- Use existing graph library (reactflow, vis-network, or Cytoscape.js)
- Show blocking/blocked-by relationships
- Interactive: click to navigate, drag to rearrange
- Color-code by status
- Layout algorithms: hierarchical, force-directed

Consider reusing DevFlow's existing graph-view components.

title: Implement WebSocket for Real-Time Updates
description:
Adapt beads-ui's WebSocket protocol for DevFlow:

1. Server endpoint: `/api/beads/ws`
2. Message types: `snapshot`, `upsert`, `delete`, `list-delta`
3. Client: `BeadsWebSocketClient` class
4. Update Zustand store on push events
5. Connection status indicator in UI
6. Auto-reconnect on disconnect

Protocol should match beads-ui's message format for compatibility.

title: Create Issue Creation and Editing UI
description:
Implement dialogs for:

1. **New Issue Dialog** (`new-issue-dialog.tsx`):
   - Title (required)
   - Description (markdown)
   - Type (bug, feature, task, epic)
   - Priority (P0-P4)
   - Initial dependencies

2. **Edit Issue Dialog** (`edit-issue-dialog.tsx`):
   - All fields editable
   - Status transitions
   - Add/remove dependencies
   - Add/remove labels

Follow DevFlow's existing dialog patterns (see feature dialogs).

title: Add Beads Settings Section
description:
Create Beads configuration in DevFlow settings:

1. Add `beads` to settings navigation
2. Create `beads-section.tsx` with:
   - Connection status (BD_PATH, database location)
   - Sync branch configuration
   - Auto-sync toggle
   - Filter preferences
   - Display settings (compact vs detailed)

Store settings in DevFlow's settings store.

title: Write Tests for Beads Integration
description:
Create comprehensive tests:

**Backend** (`apps/server/tests/beads/`):
- CLI wrapper tests (mock spawn)
- Subscription registry tests
- API endpoint tests (integration)

**Frontend** (`apps/ui/tests/beads/`):
- Component tests (issue list, detail)
- Hook tests (useBeadsClient, useBeadsIssues)
- E2E tests (create issue workflow)

Use existing test patterns from DevFlow.

title: Documentation for Beads Integration
description:
Write documentation:

1. **User Guide** (`docs/beads-integration.md`):
   - What is Beads?
   - Setting up Beads with DevFlow
   - Using the Beads view
   - Keyboard shortcuts

2. **Developer Guide** (`docs/development/beads.md`):
   - Architecture overview
   - Adding new features
   - Type definitions
   - API endpoints

3. **CLAUDE.md** update:
   - Add Beads integration section
   - Document conventions

title: Create Beads Backend Integration Structure
description:
Create the directory structure for Beads integration in the DevFlow server:

- `apps/server/src/routes/beads/`
  - `index.ts` - Route registration
  - `common.ts` - Shared utilities
  - `client/` - Beads API client (CLI wrapper, subscriptions)
  - `routes/` - API endpoints (connect, ready, list, create, update)
  - `services/` - Business logic layer

title: Integration Testing and Polish
description:
Final integration phase:

1. Test with real Beads database
2. Performance testing (1000+ issues)
3. Error handling edge cases
4. Loading states and skeleton screens
5. Empty states (no issues, no connection)
6. Keyboard shortcut handling
7. Accessibility audit
8. Cross-browser testing
9. Bug fixes from testing
10. UI polish and refinement

title: Port beads-ui CLI Wrapper to TypeScript
description:
Port `server/bd.js` from beads-ui to TypeScript as `cli-wrapper.ts`. This module wraps the `bd` CLI commands for Node.js execution.

Key functions to port:
- `runBd(args, options)` - Execute bd CLI command
- `runBdJson(args, options)` - Execute and parse JSON output
- `getBdBin()` - Resolve bd executable path
- `getGitUserName()` - Get git config user.name

title: Port Subscription Registry from beads-ui
description:
Port `server/subscriptions.js` to TypeScript as `subscription-registry.ts`. This manages server-side subscriptions for real-time updates.

Data structures:
- `Subscription` - { key, itemsById, subscribers, lock }
- `computeDelta()` - Calculate added/updated/removed
- Subscription lifecycle management

title: Port List Adapters from beads-ui
description:
Port `server/list-adapters.js` to TypeScript as `list-adapters.ts`. This maps subscription types to Beads CLI commands.

Mappings to implement:
- `all-issues` → `bd list --json`
- `tab:issues` → `bd list --filter tab:issues --json`
- `tab:epics` → `bd list --filter tab:epics --json`
- `ready` → `bd ready --json`
- `detail:{id}` → `bd show {id} --json`

title: Implement Beads API Routes
description:
Create HTTP API endpoints in `apps/server/src/routes/beads/routes/`:

- `connect.ts` - POST /api/beads/connect - Initialize Beads connection
- `ready.ts` - GET /api/beads/ready - Get ready work (no blockers)
- `list.ts` - GET /api/beads/list - List all issues
- `show.ts` - GET /api/beads/show/:id - Get issue details
- `create.ts` - POST /api/beads/create - Create new issue
- `update.ts` - POST /api/beads/update - Update issue
- `sync.ts` - POST /api/beads/sync - Git synchronization

All routes should follow DevFlow's existing API patterns with proper error handling.

title: Add Beads Integration Types to DevFlow
description:
Add Beads-specific types to `libs/@automaker/types/src/`:

- `Issue` - Core issue structure (id, title, status, priority, etc.)
- `Status` enum - open, in_progress, blocked, deferred, closed
- `IssueType` enum - bug, feature, task, epic, chore
- `Dependency` - Relationship graph edges
- `Comment` - Issue comments
- `WorkFilter` - Query specification
- `BeadsIntegration` - DevFlow integration settings

These types should match Beads core Go structures.

title: Add Beads State to DevFlow Zustand Store
Add Beads View Mode and Navigation Entry
description:
1. Add 'beads' to ViewMode type in `apps/ui/src/store/app-store.ts`
2. Add navigation entry in `sidebar-navigation.tsx`:
   - id: 'beads'
   - label: 'Beads'
   - icon: Network (or appropriate)
   - shortcut: 'B'
3. Add keyboard shortcut to keyboard shortcuts config
